Then, the blue copper acetate solution was introduced drop wise to the colorless HL1 solution and a green solution was obtained. The latter was stirred for 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min and after 1 week of slow evaporation of the solvent at room temperature, green single-crystals (suitable for X-ray data characterizations) were grown. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">28</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">32</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">12</ce:inf>S<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: C, 38.93; H, 3.73; Cu, 14.71; N, 12.97; O, 22.23; S, 7.42. Found: C, 39.31; H, 3.43; Cu, 14.52; N, 12.80%. IR, <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">max</ce:inf> (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3371 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">as</ce:sup>(NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 1571 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>C<ce:glyph name="dbnd"></ce:glyph>O, 1148 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(SO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 1071 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(SO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 771 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(S–N).</ce:para><ce:section-title>[Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(L2)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]·(MeOH)·0.3H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0030" view="all">To a methanolic solution (5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of copper acetate salt (0.50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmole), a methanolic solution of the bioactive HL2 sulfonamide ligand (sulfamerazine, 1.26<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmole) was added at room temperature. After 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min of stirring, a concentrated solution of NH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (25% volume) was added drop wise until the apparition of an intense blue color characteristic of the presence of the [Cu(NH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>]<ce:sup loc="post">2+</ce:sup> complex. After few days, the solution color turned to green and single-crystal for X-ray characterizations were obtained by slow evaporation of the solvent. <ce:italic>Anal.</ce:italic> Calc. for C<ce:inf loc="post">44</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">44</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>S<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>: C, 44.78; H, 3.76; Cu, 10.77; N, 18.99; O, 10.84; S, 10.87. Found: C, 44.72; H, 3.81; Cu, 10.64; N, 18.92. IR, <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">max</ce:inf> (cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 3358, <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>
<ce:sup loc="post">as</ce:sup>(NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 1594 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>/C–C(Ph), 669 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(C–S), 1269 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(SO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 1073 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(SO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 881 <ce:italic>ν</ce:italic>(S–N).</ce:para><ce:section-title>{Cu(L1)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(bipy)}<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>·2<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O·<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>CH<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>OH (<ce:bold>1′</ce:bold>)</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0035" view="all">The same procedure was used as for <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> with Cu(ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>0 (0.50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmole, 146<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg)/3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>equiv. of 4,4′-bypiridin (1.5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmole, 235<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg)/1.2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>equiv. of sulfadimethoxine (L1H, 0.60<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmole, 186<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg). Single green crystals were obtained.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Experimental details

Synthesis

[Cu2Ac2(L1)2]⋅2CH3CN (1)

Copper acetate salt (0.5mmol) and the HL1 bioactive sulfonamide ligand (1mmol) were dissolved separately in 5mL of CH3CN. Then, the blue copper acetate solution was introduced drop wise to the colorless HL1 solution and a green solution was obtained. The latter was stirred for 10min and after 1 week of slow evaporation of the solvent at room temperature, green single-crystals (suitable for X-ray data characterizations) were grown. Anal. Calc. for C28H32Cu2N8O12S2: C, 38.93; H, 3.73; Cu, 14.71; N, 12.97; O, 22.23; S, 7.42. Found: C, 39.31; H, 3.43; Cu, 14.52; N, 12.80%. IR, ν max (cm-1): 3371 ν as(NH2), 1571 νCO, 1148 ν(SO2), 1071 ν(SO2), 771 ν(S-N).

[Cu2(L2)4]⋅(MeOH)⋅0.3H2O (2)

To a methanolic solution (5mL) of copper acetate salt (0.50mmole), a methanolic solution of the bioactive HL2 sulfonamide ligand (sulfamerazine, 1.26mmole) was added at room temperature. After 3min of stirring, a concentrated solution of NH3 (25% volume) was added drop wise until the apparition of an intense blue color characteristic of the presence of the [Cu(NH3)6]2+ complex. After few days, the solution color turned to green and single-crystal for X-ray characterizations were obtained by slow evaporation of the solvent. Anal. Calc. for C44H44Cu2N16O8S4: C, 44.78; H, 3.76; Cu, 10.77; N, 18.99; O, 10.84; S, 10.87. Found: C, 44.72; H, 3.81; Cu, 10.64; N, 18.92. IR, ν max (cm-1): 3358, ν as(NH2), 1594 νNH2/C-C(Ph), 669 ν(C-S), 1269 ν(SO2), 1073 ν(SO2), 881 ν(S-N).

{Cu(L1)2(bipy)} n ⋅2nH2O⋅nCH3OH (1')

The same procedure was used as for 2 with Cu(ClO4)2⋅2H20 (0.50mmole, 146mg)/3equiv. of 4,4'-bypiridin (1.5mmole, 235mg)/1.2equiv. of sulfadimethoxine (L1H, 0.60mmole, 186mg). Single green crystals were obtained.
